SQI1XCON1.name: TYPECMD
SQI1XCON1.caption: The boot controller will send the command in Single Lane, Dual Lane, or Quad Lane.

values.caption: Quad Lane mode command is enabled
Dual Lane mode command is enabled
Single Lane mode command is enabled

SQI1XCON1.name: TYPEADDR
SQI1XCON1.caption: The boot controller will send the address in Single Lane, Dual Lane, or Quad Lane.

values.caption: Quad Lane mode address is enabled
Dual Lane mode address is enabled
Single Lane mode address is enabled

SQI1XCON1.name: TYPEMODE
SQI1XCON1.caption: The boot controller will send the mode in Single Lane, Dual Lane, or Quad Lane.

SQI1XCON1.name: TYPEDUMMY
SQI1XCON1.caption: The boot controller will send the dummy in Single Lange, Dual Lane, or Quad Lane

values.caption: Quad Lane mode dummy is enabled
Dual Lane mode dummy is enabled
Single Lange mode dummy is enabled

SQI1XCON1.name: TYPEDATA
SQI1XCON1.caption: The boot controller will receive the data in Single Lane, Dual Lane, or Quad Lane.

values.caption: Quad Lane mode data is enabled
Dual Lane mode data is enabled
Single Lane mode data is enabled
Transmit seven dummy bytes after the address bytes
Transmit six dummy bytes after the address bytes
Transmit five dummy bytes after the address bytes
Transmit four dummy bytes after the address bytes
Transmit three dummy bytes after the address bytes
Transmit two dummy bytes after the address bytes
Transmit one dummy bytes after the address bytes
Transmit zero dummy bytes after the address bytes
SQI command bytes are transferred in DDR mode
SQI command bytes are transferred in SDR mode
SQI address bytes are transferred in DDR mode
SQI address bytes are transferred in SDR mode
SQI mode bytes are transferred in DDR mode
SQI mode bytes are transferred in SDR mode
SQI dummy bytes are transferred in DDR mode
SQI dummy bytes are transferred in SDR mode
SQI data bytes are transferred in DDR mode
SQI data bytes are transferred in SDR mode

SQI1XCON1.name: SDRCMD
SQI1XCON1.caption: SQI Command in SDR Mode bit

values.caption: SQI command is in SDR mode and SQI data is in DDR mode
SQI command is in DDR mode and SQI data is in DDR mode
XIP mode is selected (when this mode is entered, the module behaves as if executing in place (XIP),but uses the register data to control timing)
CPU mode is selected (the module is controlled by the CPU in PIO mode. This mode is entered whenleaving Boot or XIP mode)
SQICLK starts toggling at the start of the first data bit
SQICLK starts toggling at the middle of the first data bit
Active-low SQICLK (SQICLK high is the Idle state)
Active-high SQICLK (SQICLK low is the Idle state)
LSB is send or received first
MSB is sent or received first
A reset pulse is not generated
A reset pulse is generated clearing the transmit buffer
A reset pulse is not generated
A reset pulse is generated clearing the receive buffer
A reset pulse is not generated
A reset pulse is generated, clearing the control buffer
A reset pulse is not generated
SQID1 and SQID0 data outputs are enabled
Chip Select 0 and Chip Select 1 are used
Chip Select 1 is used (Chip Select 0 is not used)
Chip Select 0 is used (Chip Select 1 is not used)
Chip Select 0 and Chip Select 1 are not used
Chip Select is deasserted after transmission or reception of the specified number of bytes
Chip Select is not deasserted after transmission or reception of the specified number of bytes
Set the SQI transfers to DDR mode
Set the SQI transfers to SDR mode
Check the status of the Flash
Do not check the status of the Flash

SQI1CLKCON.caption: SQI Clock Tsqi Frequency Select bits

values.caption: Base Clock Tbc is divided by 2048
Base Clock Tbc is divided by 1024
Base Clock Tbc is divided by 512
Base Clock Tbc is divided by 256
Base Clock Tbc is divided by 128
Base Clock Tbc is divided by 64
Base Clock Tbc is divided by 32
Base Clock Tbc is divided by 16
Base Clock Tbc is divided by 8
Base clock Tbc is divided by 4
Base clock Tbc is divided by 2

SQI1MEMSTAT.name: STATPOS
SQI1MEMSTAT.caption: Statis Bit Position in Flash bit

values.caption: BUSY bit position is bit 7 in status register
BUSY bit position is bit 0 in status register
INIT1 commands are sent in Quad Lane mode
INIT1 commands are sent in Dual Lane mode
INIT1 commadns are sent in Single Lane mode
INIT1CMD3, INIT1CMD2, and INIT1CMD3 are sent.
INIT1CMD1 and INIT1CMD2 are sent, but INIT1CMD3 is still pending.
INIT1CMD1 is sent, but INIT1CMD2 and INIT1CMD3 are still pending.
